home.heroHeadline: ISO17088 certified compostable alternatives to single-use plastics (SUPs).
home.heroSubhead: Research-backed biodegradable products (bags, bottles, films, and more) designed for a circular economy.
missionParagraphs: Our objective is to design and deploy viable green technologies that mitigate GHG emissions by delivering effective solutions, products, and processes for climate and solid-waste challenges. We focus on practical compostable alternatives that reduce dependence on bio-hazardous plastics and petro-polymers while remaining fit for real-world use.

The lifecycle we establish minimizes greenhouse-gas contribution across production, usage, and end-of-life. It is built to preserve soil fertility and support mass afforestation with low financial and human effort. After use, materials aerobically decompose into compostable manure that enriches soil, supports germination, and sustains plant growth.
missionBullets: Low-emission lifecycle from production to compost.
Supports large-scale afforestation with minimal cost and effort.
Enhances soil health through compostable end-of-life conversion.

about.headline: A research-led path to large-scale plastic reduction.
about.copy: At The Green Mantra, we are driven by research, design rigor, and deployment-focused innovation to deliver compostable alternatives to single-use plastics. With IPR-backed product development and ecosystem partnerships, we translate environmental intent into scalable outcomes that support climate action and responsible material transition.

journey.heading: Our Journey
journey.intro: Recognized as a Startup India-aligned MSME, Vertex Enterprises advanced from concept incubation to real-world compostable product deployment through sustained R&D and partnership-led commercialization.
bullets: Innovation work began in July 2016 and matured through iterative field-grounded trials.
The initiative progressed from idea incubation and R&D to product development and market introduction.
Early-stage support from MANTRA-led institutional and CSR collaboration enabled venture formation.
